txt.en: 'I trust I am not too late to join.'
'It is commendable that you wish to aid the boy, but I must finish the other lots before we can discuss an arrangement.'
'The Falcon-clan bids eight.'
'The boy will pay his father's debt. Whether through the war-camps or the mines, I will get what is owed to me.'
Instance: The Auction
'I do not know what I am going to do. I will not survive two days in the mines or war camps...'
'You have poisoned our clan for too long, Wizard. You are destroying the Uch-l√ªth!'
'I will watch over the boy. He will be safe with the clan.'
'No! I will not stand for this!'
'Now, back to business. You know the rules of the clan, Mabon. A debt is a debt.'
'This sale did not bring in enough to clear your father's debt. As such, it is now your debt.'
'Father! No! No one ever comes back! Please!'
Many merchants have gathered here tonight.
'Once this auction is finished, we can discuss how you will begin to repay it.'
'How can this be happening? We just came to make a sale....'
Many merchants have gathered here tonight.
Many merchants have gathered here tonight.
'We will open the bidding on the first lot: a cart full of goods from the northern lands.'
Talk to Bedwur
'You have done nothing but prosper as a clan with my guidance and advice.'
'Of course not. We have just started on a new lot, a cart of valuables from the North.'
Observe the auction
'If you disagree, perhaps we should continue this conversation elsewhere.'
Talk to Bedwur
'Thank you all for attending today. We have several lots up for auction.'
'Come, be my guest at Isengard, and I will show you all that I have done for your people.'
'Sold to Isengard for five! The next lot will be a set of cattle registration tags.'
'The boy stays. These are conversations for adults. You would not want him to get caught up in things above his station, would you?'
'The Falcon-clan bids ten.'
'I tire of this. We leave now.'
Merchants of the Ox-clan gather frequently for auctions, where large amounts of goods -- and money -- trade hands.
'Father, please. This is not the place.'
'Please. Watch after my boy...I beg you all. See that he is safe.'
'Isengard bids five.'
'The Falcon-clan bids six.'
'I see that you are all here... and, I assume, ready to begin. Andras even brought his boy with him. I hope his wares fetch a price that is not embarrassing.\n\n'Shall we begin then?'
